metadata.Title: CVE-2019-2182 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
In the Android kernel in the kernel MMU code there is a possible executionpath leaving some kernel text and rodata pages writable. This could lead tolocal escalation of privilege with no additional execution privilegesneeded. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-2182` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1063.67~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1075.80
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1058.62
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1035.38~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.2.0-1013-raspi2 - 4.2.0-1013.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1013-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1013.15
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-16.19').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1063.67~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1075.80').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1058.62').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1035.38~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-1013.19').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1013.15').
